definition: (Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: The third part is Introduce and Reference of the Foreign Experience.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，惩罚性国家赔偿的域外经验与借镜。

sentences.english: Every failure or success is a glimpse into the future.
sentences.chinese: 生命里，每一次的成败都是未来的借镜。

sentences.english: Dongsha marine park could be a model for how to handle other disputed islets.
sentences.chinese: 东沙环礁国家公园也许可以作为其他争议之岛的借镜。

sentences.english: You can borrow from my experience in learning German.
sentences.chinese: 我自已学德语的经历可以给你们借镜。

definition: benchmark/pole serving as mark or symbol/pole with a trophy hung on it
to imitate/to follow the example of
to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
in order that/so that/so as to/to cause sth
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
